result.execSummary:
The defendant Paul Gilbert Martinez was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of Narcotic Drugs, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(am).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: REVIEW HEARING APRIL 2, 2015 AT 8:15 IN BR. 38.

miscConds.notes:
Pay all court costs, assessments and victim witness surcharges, DNA surcharge.  
If revoked, to be collected by DOC from 25% of prison account under Sec. 973.05(4)(b) and as a condition of Extended Supervision.  Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment.
Seek and maintain full time employment.

Provide a DNA sample for the data bank, pay all appropriate costs.
The defendant advised as a convicted felon he may not carry or possess any firearms/body armor; and that his voting rights are suspended during the length of sentence.
No contact with drug houses, drug dealers, drug paraphernalia or known gang members.
AODA and other counseling needs to be determined. Random urine screens.

cf
Per Order signed on June 30, 2015:  commitment ordered, to serve 15 days straight time.  No good time credit.
Order for Commitment for Condition Time for Non-Compliance with Probation Conditions.  Order signed and filed.

Defendant Paul Gilbert Martinez in court with attorney Calvin R. Malone.  Paul M. Hauer appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Probation Agent Jennifer Sauer also present in court.
DOC has issued a warrant for defendant's arrest and will place a hold on him.  Allegations of child neglect being reviewed by the DA's office.
The department is requesting a 15 day commitment of condition time be imposed. The court will sign order for commitment for 15 days straight time with no good time credit.  Defendant is taken into custody.
Court of Appeals order dated April 2, 2015, Appeal 2015XX486CR, the deadline to file a post-conviction motion or notice of appeal is extended to April 29, 2015.

Defendant Paul Gilbert Martinez in court with attorney Calvin R. Malone.  Paul M. Hauer appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Branch 12 for Branch 38
PO Jennifer Sauer also present in court.    Written Court Memo and Update filed with the court.
The court has reviewed the information provided and admonishes the defendant that he has not made a satisfactory attempt to comply with his conditions of supervision.
The defendant is directed to make payments as to his financial obligations and to find gainful employment.
The court will set another review in 3 months on 6-30-2015 at 8:15.  Review hearing scheduled for June 30, 2015 at 08:15 am.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Paul Gilbert Martinez in court with attorney Mary D. Scholle.  Paul M. Hauer appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  CASE HEARD FOR BRANCH 17.
Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by state, defense and defendant.
The Court sentenced the defendant to serve a term of IMPRISONMENT of 28  MONTHS in the Wisconsin State Prisons, with credit for 2 days time served.  CONFINEMENT of 15 MONTHS and EXTENDED SUPERVISION of 13 MONTHS.  The Court STAYED the sentence and placed the defendant on probation to the State Department of Corrections for a period of 21 MONTHS.  Conditions of probation include:
-Serve 5 MONTHS in the House of Correction STAYED for review on 4-2-2015 at 8:15 in Branch 38.
-The Court ordered that all court costs, fines, surcharges and/or restitution be paid through collection by the Department of Corrections from 25% of prison account under Sec. 973.05(4)(b) and as a condition of extended supervision.  Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment.
-Pay all court costs, assessments and victim/witness surcharges, DNA surcharge.
-Provide a DNA sample for the Data Bank and pay all appropriate costs.
-ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY.
-AODA and other counseling needs to be determined; random urine screens.
-Seek and maintain full-time employment.
-Perform 24 hours of community service at a non-profit charitable organization.
-No contact with DRUG HOUSES, DRUG DEALERS, DRUG PARAPHERNALIA or known gang members.
The defendant is advised as a convicted felon he may not carry or possess any firearms/body armor.
The defendant is advised that voting rights are suspended during length of sentence.
The defendant is advised of his appeal rights by defense counsel.
The defendant is eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program.     
The defendant is eligible for the Wisconsin Substance Abuse Program.  
Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief filed.
Justice Point Pretrial Report dated October 1, 2014, received and filed.
Milwaukee County Pretrial Services Violation Report re: Missed Office Contact/Drug Test, received and filed.

Defendant Paul Gilbert Martinez in court with attorney Mary D. Scholle.  Paul M. Hauer appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Case scheduled for Plea Hearing. 
Defendant examined as to plea, advised of Constitutional Rights and the maximum penalties. Defendant enters a plea of Guilty. Court found that the defendant knowingly, voluntarily and intelligently waived rights.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights form, received and filed. Parties stipulate to the Criminal Complaint is a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea.  Court found defendant GUILTY and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record.  

Court advised due to felony conviction the defendant is prohibited from firearm possession, and defendant's voting rights are suspended and may not vote until civil rights are restored.
Note:  Court REITERATES that the defendant MAINTAIN Absolute Sobriety and NOT possess or use any controlled substances unless by valid prescription.  
Court orders case adjourned for Sentencing 10-2-2014 at 8:30 a.m., Br. 17. 

Ineligible Voting Notice and Acknowledgement, received and filed. 

  Sentencing hearing scheduled for October 2, 2014 at 08:30 am.
Justice Point Pretrial Report dated August 21, 2014, received and filed.

Defendant Paul Gilbert Martinez in court with attorney Valeria Taylor for Mary D. Scholle.  Paul M. Hauer appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: TC. Joint request for an adjournment, granted by the Court. All parties are notified that effective 08-03-14 this case will be assigned to Judge Stark, Branch 17, in Room 313 of the Safety Building.
Court ordered case adjourned for projected guilty plea in Branch 17.  Plea hearing scheduled for August 22, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Justice Point Violation Report; received and filed.   Deputy Court Clerk: TC. Case in court due to violation.  Arguments heard as to bail.  Court admonishes Defendant. No action taken at this time.  Case remains calendared for Projected guilty plea on August 22, 2014 at 8:30 a.m. in Branch 17.
Justice Point Program dated July 24, 2014; received and filed. Deputy Court Clerk: TC.
MOTION HEARING

Defendant Paul Gilbert Martinez in court with attorney Mary D Scholle.  Paul M Hauer appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Motion to Suppress proceeded.  Court ordered sequestration.  Sworn for the State:  Officer Christopher Conway, MPD.  Exhibits 1 - 7 offered, # 1, #6, and #7 received and all exhibits retained in file pending further proceedings.  Sworn for the State:  Officer Steven Jegen, MPD.    Case passed.  Later same day, case recalled, same appearances.  State rests subject to rebuttal.  Defense counsel played DVD for the court.  Sworn for the Defense:  Paul Martinez, Defendant.  State rests.  Testimony closed.  Closing arguments made by the State and defense.  Based on all filings, testimony and evidence in court, the court  finds that there was probable cause for the search and seizure therefore they were legal.  Therefore, the court DENIED defense motion to suppress.  Case set for guilty plea hearing on 7-25-14, 8:30.
Filed by the Defense:  Reply to State's Response to Defendant's Motion to Suppress.  alp
Filed by the State:  Response to Defendant's Motion and Motion and Motion to Suppress Evidence from a Stop and Search. alp
State's Response To Defendant's Motion and Motion To Suppress [Evidence] From A Stop And Search, filed by ADA Paul M. Hauer.
Filed by the Defense:  Notice of Motion and Motion to Suppress-Illegal Stop and Search.

Defendant Paul Gilbert Martinez in court with attorney Mary D Scholle.  Patricia I Daugherty appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Deputy Court Clerk: alp  Motion hearing scheduled for 06-26-2014 at 01:30 pm.
Filed, VIOLATION REPORT.

Defendant Paul Gilbert Martinez in court with attorney Mary D. Scholle.  Kevin Shomin for Paul M. Hauer appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the state:Christopher Conway-MPD Officer.  State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and pleads not guilty.  Scheduling conference scheduled for May 1, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Filed, Justice Point Pretrial Report dated 4/9/14.
css

Court orders defendant TURNED OVER to JUSTICE Point for Supervision.  ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY  to be monitored by drug testing and portable breathalyzers.
No use or possession of controlled substances without a valid prescription, no drug paraphernalia and no alcohol.
Defendant advised it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.
Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Paul Gilbert Martinez in court with attorney Mary D. Scholle.  Defendant Paul Gilbert Martinez in custody.  Carole R. Manchester appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Pocan, Branch 26. Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for April 10, 2014 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
